text:
Use of resources for the year ending with 31 March 2011
	The use of resources for the service of the year ending with 31 March 2011 isauthorised to the amount of £5,776,805,000.
Issue out of the Consolidated Fund for the year ending with 31 March 2011
	The Treasury may issue out of the Consolidated Fund of the United Kingdom andapply to the service of the year ending with 31 March 2011 the sum of£5,707,827,000.
Vote on Account for 2011—12
	The use of resources for the year ending with 31 March 2012 is authorisedup to the amount of £245,218,342,000.
	Of the amount authorised by subsection (1)—
		£222,632,387,000 is authorised for use for current purposes; and
		£22,585,955,000 is authorised for use for capital purposes.
	The Treasury may—
		issue money out of the Consolidated Fund, and
		apply it in the year ending with 31 March 2012 for expenditure authorisedby Parliament,
			up to the amount of £203,352,310,000.
Short title
	This Act may be cited as the Consolidated Fund Act 2010.
